milestones.figcaption: Optoma launched RD65- World’s Largest 65” Rear-Projection TV
The H30 won the CES 2004 Innovations Award.
Announced revolutionary MovieTime™ DV10, the all-in-one digital DVD projector at CES 2005.Optoma's SV50XF DLP® TV wins the CES 2005 Innovations Award.
Optoma launched HD81- World’s 1st 1080P Home Cinema Projector.
The NO.1 selling DLP® projector brand worldwide in 2007 (PMA Research).
Winner of the 'Good Design Award' for EX525ST, PK101, and EP783 announced by the Ministry of Economic Affairs, Taiwan.
Optoma's HD86 won the CEA 2010 Best Projector Award. Launched world’s first 3D projector adaptor (3D-XL).
Announced world's first iPod dock pico projector, the Neo-i The Neo-i went on to win the CES Innovation Award.
Optoma launched ZX210ST/ZW210ST- Optoma’s 1st Laser-LED Hybrid projector.
Launched evolutionary ultra-mobile LED projector range, the ML750 and ML1000.
Launched the ZU650, Optoma’s first projector utilizing laser phosphor illumination technology.
Announced industry first IP-certified, dust resistant DuraCore laser light engine line-up:ZU650+, ZU850, ZU510T, ZH/ZW400UST/i.
Optoma launched ProScene ZU850 featuring multicolor laser projector with ultimate color performance.
Announced World’s 1st Smart Projector to support home automation, voice control, personal media center and App Marketplace (UHL55) (UHD51A).
Announced all-in-one QUAD LED display (FHDQ130), ProScene 4K UHD Laser Projector (ZK1050) and the Dolby Digital 2.0 Smart 4K UHD Laser Cinema (P1).
